metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43537 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An incorrect type conversion of sizes from 64bit to 32bit integers allowed an attacker to corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, and Firefox < 95.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
